taskMan

Class Project

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskMan.Project

  • public class Project
extends java.lang.Object
    The project class used by TaskMan. A project will always have a unique identifier, a name, a description, a creation time, a due time, a status and a list containing all tasks assigned to this project. A project will also know if a task is another one's alternative or if a task depends on a series of other tasks. A project can be either ongoing or finished.
    Author:
    Tim Van Den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel and Eli Vangrieken

      • Project

        public Project(int projectID,
       java.lang.String projectName,
       java.lang.String description,
       LocalDateTime creationTime,
       LocalDateTime dueTime)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new Project.
        Parameters:
        projectID - The ID of the new Project.
        projectName - The name of the new Project.
        description - The description of the new Project.
        creationTime - The creation time of the new Project.
        dueTime - The due time of the new Project.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws exception when the dueTime comes before the creationTime.

        public boolean createTask(java.lang.String description,

                 LocalDateTime startTime,
                 LocalDateTime endTime)
        Creates a new Task with a status of failed or finished.
        Parameters:
        description - The description of the given Task.
        estimatedDuration - The estimated duration of the Task.
        acceptableDeviation - The acceptable deviation of the Task.
        taskStatus - The Status of the Task.
        alternativeFor - The alternative Task.
        prerequisiteTasks - The prerequisites Tasks for this Task.
        startTime - The start time of the Task.
        endTime - The end time of the Task.
        Returns:
        True if and only the creation of a Task with a status of failed or finished was successful.

        Parameters:

      • isEstimatedOnTime

        public boolean isEstimatedOnTime(LocalDateTime currentTime)
        A check to determine if the project will end on time
        Parameters:
        currentTime - The current time of the system
        Returns:
        True if the estimated required time to finish all tasks is less than the time until the project due time
